cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles (100 km) south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Laura is forecast to continue moving west-northwest today, enter the southeastern Gulf of Mexico tonight, then turn northwest Tuesday night and approach the Texas-Louisiana coastline late Wednesday into early Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast (around Cameron–Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches confined to the Florida Keys (Craig Key to Key West).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings across much of Cuba, Little Cayman, Cayman Brac, and Dry Tortugas.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and north-western Gulf Coast from Texas through Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-73 mph) possible late Wednesday through Thursday; a shift westward could bring hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for 3–6 ft surge along the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay, if the center tracks close to the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 5–10 inches with locally higher amounts, causing urban and low-land flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; elevated seas and dangerous rip currents affecting vessel operations.
